precarious_papers.pipelines.data_science package¶

Example code for the nodes in the example pipeline. This code is meant just for illustrating basic Kedro features.

PLEASE DELETE THIS FILE ONCE YOU START WORKING ON YOUR OWN PROJECT!

Submodules¶

precarious_papers.pipelines.data_science.nodes module¶

precarious_papers.pipelines.data_science.nodes.backwards_selection(X, y, W)[source]¶

Formulate model estimates as tabular results

Parameters:
  • X (pd.DataFrame) – Firm characteristics
  • y (pd.DataFrame) – Firm returns over event window
  • W (pd.DataFrame) – spatial weighting matrix
Returns:

Estimates and statistics from backwards selection procedure
Return type:

pd.DataFrame
precarious_papers.pipelines.data_science.nodes.get_slx_basis(X, W, drop_features=['price_to_earnings', 'market_capitalization', 'centrality'])[source]¶

estimate weighting matrix and estimate

Parameters:
  • X (pd.DataFrame) – Firm characteristics
  • W (pd.DataFrame) – Spatial weighting matrix
  • drop_features (List, optional) – Features to remove based on significance, defaults to [“price_to_earnings”, “market_capitalization”, “centrality”]
Returns:

Model parameters estimates and statistical tests
Return type:

pd.DataFrame
precarious_papers.pipelines.data_science.nodes.get_spatial_statistics(spatial_model)[source]¶

Extracts and formals estimates and statistics from spatial model

Parameters:spatial_model (ps.model.spreg.ols.OLS) – Estimated pysal non-spatial ols model
Returns:Model estimates and statistics
Return type:pd.Series
precarious_papers.pipelines.data_science.nodes.get_spatial_weights(X, y, D)[source]¶

estimate weighting matrix and estimate

Parameters:
  • X (pd.DataFrame) – Firm characteristics
  • y (pd.DataFrame) – Market returns
  • D (pd.DataFrame) – Shortest path distances between firms
Returns:

Spatial weighting matrix using weibull distribution
Return type:

pd.DataFrame

precarious_papers.pipelines.data_science.pipeline module¶

Example code for the nodes in the example pipeline. This code is meant just for illustrating basic Kedro features.

Delete this when you start working on your own Kedro project.
